sections: Here’s your chance to own a legend…
Few supercars are named after titans of the auto industry, making this

an exceptional machine. A successor of the Ferrari F40 and F50, the Enzo not only carried the name of the founder but also a legacy of bringing Formula One-style performance to the road in great style. That’s what makes it so exciting that this supercar will be crossing the block at

Now a relic of the past, the howling 6.0-liter V12 is unlike anything you’ll find in a modern Ferrari. It puts at your command a mighty 660-horsepower, rocketing this supercar from 0-62 mph in just 3.65 seconds. With a top speed in excess of 217 mph, even by today’s standards this is a truly fast vehicle.

For some, all Ferraris must be draped in red. However, not everyone feels that way and the way the yellow paint flaunts the curvaceous body on this Enzo is proof of why that is. When combined with black accents and those split 5-spoke wheels, plus the telltale Scuderia Ferrari fender shields, this supercar looks absolutely fantastic.

Inside, yellow gauge faces make for a connection with that captivating body. Soft brown leather on the seats, door pulls, and underside of the dash provide a level of luxury many wouldn’t expect. It’s easy to see the motorsports influence in the cabin when looking at the ignition button and the multifunction steering wheel.

when it launched since the Italian brand was absolutely dominating F1 racing at the dawn of a new millennium. Considering the new supercar incorporated technologies and designs from the motorsport, excitement was understandably high. That enthusiasm for the supercar has made it a sought-after collectible which commands respect and lofty prices at auction.
